Deterrence may not be immediate. Some studies look at **short-term effects** (e.g., murders per year), while others consider **long-term trends**. The **"chilling effect"** of an execution might be delayed, or the **"brutalizing effect"** (where the death penalty normalizes violence) might only emerge over time.
